title: Periodic waves - highest frequency in setups ABCD

content.description: The figure shows four similar setups. In each setup, the left end of a taut string is attached to a machine that can oscillate up and down, and the machine’s oscillations cause a wave to propagate along the string. The mass per length is not necessarily the same for each string, and the right ends of the strings (not shown) are pulled with different amounts of constant tension.
content.question: The machines are initially turned off, and then all turned on at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. The figure shows the strings a short time later at <math alttext="t equals delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></math>. In which setup does the wave on the string have the highest frequency?

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
